group.name: Appearance
group.description:
The resolution is best left unset, which means to use the currently used by X, which is preferably set to match the native resolution of the display. In general, what is important is the aspect ratio but using the native resolution for X and slideshow ensures that pixels aren't scaled in any way.
If the display forces another resolution or aspect ratio than X uses (e.g some widescreen projectors) set the virtual resolution to the resolution used by the display and the regular resolution to the resolution used by X. However, be careful using virtual resolution as the slides will be stretched. It is suggested to use a resolution which matches either dimension and is an as close match as possible.
